error.auth_proxy_failed.legend: 2Fauth is configured to run behind an authentication proxy but your proxy does not return the expected header. Check your configuration and try again.
error.cannot_create_otp_without_secret: Cannot create an OTP without a secret
error.data_cannot_be_refreshed_from_serv: Data cannot be refreshed from server
error.failed_to_load_settings: Failed to load settings from the store
error.failed_to_retrieve_encryption_stor: Failed to retrieve encryption store data
error.failed_to_set_autolock_delay: Failed to set the auto-lock delay
error.invalid_or_unknown_token: Invalid or unknown personal access token
error.not_a_supported_otp_type: This OTP format is not currently supported
error.unauthorized.legend: You do not have permissions to view this resource or to perform this action
error.no_valid_otp: No valid OTP resource in this QR code
error.something_wrong_with_server: Something is wrong with your server
error.data_of_qrcode_is_not_valid_URI: The data of this QR code is not a valid OTP Auth URI. The QR code contains:
error.error_during_encryption: Encryption failed, your database remains unprotected.
error.error_during_decryption: Decryption failed, your database is still protected. This is mainly caused by an integrity issue of encrypted data for one or more accounts.
error.too_many_ids: too many ids were included in the query parameter, max 100 allowed
error.delete_user_setting_only: Only user-created setting can be deleted
error.cannot_decipher_secret: The secret cannot be deciphered. This is mainly caused by a wrong APP_KEY set in the .env configuration file of 2Fauth or a corrupted data stored in database.
error.browser_does_not_support_webauthn: Your device does not support webauthn. Try again later using a more modern browser
error.security_error_check_rpid: Security error: Check your WEBAUTHN_ID env var
error.2fauth_has_not_a_valid_domain: 2FAuth's domain is not a valid domain
error.user_id_not_between_1_64: User ID was not between 1 and 64 chars
error.unsupported_with_reverseproxy: Not applicable when using an auth proxy or SSO
error.unsupported_with_sso_only: This authentication method is for administrators only. Users must log in with SSO.
error.user_deletion_failed: User account deletion failed, no data have been deleted
error.unsupported_migration: Data do not match any supported format
error.no_icon_for_this_variant: No icon available in this variant
error.cannot_delete_the_only_admin: Cannot delete the only admin account
error.cannot_demote_the_only_admin: Cannot demote the only admin account
error.error_during_data_fetching: üíÄ Something went wrong during data fetching
error.sso_bad_provider_setup: This SSO provider is not fully setup in your .env file
error.sso_email_already_used: A user account with the same email address already exists but it does not match your external account ID. Do not use SSO if you are already registered on 2FAuth with this email.
error.account_managed_by_external_provid: Account managed by an external provider
error.no_pwd_reset_for_this_user_type: Password reset unavailable for this user
error.cannot_detect_qrcode_in_image: Cannot detect a QR code in the image, try to crop the image
error.cannot_decode_detected_qrcode: Cannot decode detected QR code, try to crop or sharpen the image
error.failed_icon_store_database_togglin: Migration of icons failed. The setting has been restored to its previous value.
error.reserved_name_please_choose_someth: Reserved name, please choose something else
field.apiToken.help: The Personal Access Token (PAT) to authenticate the extension to the server. You can generate one from the Settings > OAuth page of your 2FAuth user account
field.auto_close_timeout.help: Automatically hide on-screen password after a timeout. This avoids unnecessary requests for fresh passwords if you forget to close the password view.
field.auto_lock.help: Lock the extension automatically to prevent illegitimate access to its data
field.clear_search_on_copy.help: Empty the Search box right after a code has been copied to the clipboard
field.close_otp_on_copy.help: Click on a generated password to copy it automatically hides it from the screen
field.copy_otp_on_display.help: Automatically copy a generated password right after it appears on screen. Due to browsers limitations, only the first TOTP password will be copied, not the rotating ones
field.default_group.help: The group to which the newly created accounts are associated
field.extCurrentPassword.help: The password currently used to unlock the extension
field.extNewPassword.help: The new password that will be used to lock this extension and encrypt sensitive data when needed
field.extPassword.help: The password that will be used to lock this extension and encrypt sensitive data when needed
field.hostUrl.help: The web address of the 2FAuth instance where you signed up. For example: https://2fauth.mysite.me
field.language.help: Language used to translate the extension interface. Named languages are complete, set the one of your choice to override your browser preference.
field.otp_generation.help: Set how and when OTPs are displayed.
field.password_format.help: Change how the passwords are displayed by grouping digits to ease readability and memorization
field.remember_active_group.help: Save the last group filter applied and restore it on your next visit
field.reveal_dotted_otp.help: Let the ability to temporarily reveal Dot-Obscured passwords
field.show_accounts_icons.help: Show account icons in the main view
field.show_next_otp.help: Preview the next password, i.e. the password that will replace the current password when it expires. Preferences set for the current OTP also apply to the next one (formatting, show as dot)
field.show_otp_as_dot.help: Replace generated password caracters with *** to ensure confidentiality. Does not affect the copy/paste feature
field.sort_case_sensitive.help: When invoked, force the Sort function to sort accounts on a case-sensitive basis
field.theme.help: Force a specific theme or apply the theme defined in your system/browser preferences
field.view_default_group_on_copy.help: Always return to the default group when an OTP is copied
message.bind_2fauth_to_use_extension: The perfect companion to your 2FAuth web application
message.field_is_required_and_valid_url: The field is required and must be a valid URL
message.half.legend: Split digits into two equals groups
message.is_pat_still_valid: Is your personal access token still valid?
message.otp_generation_on_home.title: Show all passwords in the main view, without doing anything
message.otp_generation_on_request_title: Click an account to get a password in a dedicated view
message.purpose_description: This web extension is an add-on to the 2FAuth web application. It lets you access the 2FA data of your 2FAuth user account and generate OTPs directly from your browser bar.
message.purpose_requirements: You must have a 2FAuth user account and bind it to the extension in order to use it. This is done by providing the 2FAuth server address and a Personal Access Token (PAT).
message.registration_not_supported_visit: 2FA registraton from the extension is not supported yet. Visit your 2FAuth app to add your first 2FA.
message.reset_extension_description_bis: Use this option if you forgot the extension password.
message.reset_extension_description: The extension will be stripped of its current configuration and 2FAuth data. It will be available again for rebinding to a 2FAuth user account.
message.retry_or_reset_extension: You can try to refresh (maybe it was a temporary problem) or you can reset the extension and provide a new token.
message.settings_managed_by_administrato: Some settings are being managed by your administrator
message.some_translation_are_missing: Some translations are missing using the browser preferred language?
message.spaces_are_ignored: Unwanted spaces will be automatically removed
message.token_remains_valid: This action does not revoke the personal access token in use.
message.twofauth_teaser: A browser extension to retrieve 2FA security codes generated from your 2FAuth server.
message.unlock_description: The extension is locked to protect its data. Enter the extension password to access your 2FAs.
message.demo_do_not_post_sensitive_data: This is a demo app, do not post any sensitive data
message.testing_do_not_post_sensitive_da: This is a testing app, do not post any sensitive data
message.name: Name
message.data_refreshed_to_reflect_server: Data has been refresh to reflect server-side changes
message.2fauth_teaser: A web app to manage your Two-Factor Authentication (2FA) accounts and generate their security codes
message.check_for_update_help: Automatically check (once a week) and warn when a new release of 2FAuth is published on Github
message.2fauth_description: A web app to manage your Two-Factor Authentication (2FA) accounts and generate their security codes
message.image_of_qrcode_to_scan: Image of a QR code to scan
message.admin.users_legend: Manage users registered on your instance or create new ones.
message.admin.confirm.delete_user: Are you sure you want to delete this user? There is no going back.
message.admin.confirm.request_password_r: Are you sure you want to reset this user's password?
message.admin.confirm.purge_password_res: Are you sure you want to revoke the previous request?
message.admin.confirm.delete_account: Are you sure you want to delete this user?
message.admin.confirm.edit_own_account: This is your own account. Are you sure?
message.admin.confirm.change_admin_role: This will have serious impacts on this user's permissions. Are you sure?
message.admin.confirm.demote_own_account: You will no longer be an administrator. Really sure?
message.admin.administration_legend: Following settings are global and apply to all users.
message.admin.account_bound_to_x_via_oau: This account is bound to a {provider} account via OAuth
message.admin.password_requested_on_t: A password reset request exists for this user (request sent at {datetime}), which means that the user has not yet changed their password but the link they received is still valid. This may be a request from the user themselves or from an administrator.
message.admin.password_request_expired: A password reset request exists for this user but has expired, meaning that the user has not changed their password in time. This may be a request from the user themselves or from an administrator.
message.admin.resend_email_title: Resend a password reset email to the user
message.admin.resend_email_help: Use 'Resend email' to send a new password reset email to the user so he can set a new password. This will leave its current password as is and any previous request will be revoked.
message.admin.reset_password_help: Use 'Reset password' to force a password reset (this will set a temporary password) before sending a password reset email to the user so they can set a new password. Any previous request will be revoked.
message.admin.delete_this_user_legend: The user account will be deleted as well as all its 2FA data.
message.admin.this_is_not_soft_delete: This is not a soft delete, there is no going back.
message.admin.access_log_has_more_entrie: The access log contains more entries.
message.admin.show_last_month_log: Show entries from the last month
message.admin.show_three_months_log: Show entries from the last 3 months
message.admin.show_six_months_log: Show entries from the last 6 months
message.admin.show_one_year_log: Show entries from the last year
message.admin.forms.use_encryption.label: Protect sensitive data
message.admin.forms.use_encryption.help: Sensitive data, the 2FA secrets and emails, are stored encrypted in database. Be sure to backup the APP_KEY value of your .env file (or the whole file) as it serves as key encryption. There is no way to decypher encrypted data without this key.
message.admin.forms.restrict_registratio: Make registration only available to a limited range of email addresses. Both rules can be used simultaneously. This has no effect on registration via SSO.
message.admin.forms.restrict_list.label: Filtering list
message.admin.forms.restrict_list.help: Emails in this list will be allowed to register. Separate addresses with a pipe ('|')
message.admin.forms.restrict_rule.label: Filtering rule
message.admin.forms.restrict_rule.help: Emails matching this regular expression will be allowed to register
message.admin.forms.disable_registration: Prevent new user registration. Unless overridden (see below), this affects SSO as well, so new users won't be able to sign in via SSO
message.admin.forms.enable_sso.label: Enable SSO
message.admin.forms.enable_sso.help: Allow visitors to authenticate using an external ID via the Single Sign-On scheme
message.admin.forms.use_sso_only.label: Use SSO only
message.admin.forms.use_sso_only.help: Make SSO the only available method to log in to 2FAuth. Password login and Webauthn are then disabled for regular users. Administrators are not affected by this restriction.
message.admin.forms.allow_pat_in_sso_onl: Let users create personal access tokens and use them to authenticate with third party application like the 2FAuth web extension
message.admin.forms.keep_sso_registratio: Allow new users to sign in for the first time via SSO whereas registration is disabled
message.admin.forms.is_admin.label: Is administrator
message.admin.forms.is_admin.help: Give administrator rights to the user. Administrators have permissions to manage the whole app, i.e. settings and other users, but cannot generate password for a 2FA they don't own.
message.admin.forms.test_email.label: Email configuration test
message.admin.forms.test_email.help: Send a test email to control your instance's email configuration. It is important to have a working configuration, otherwise users will not be able to request a reset password.
message.admin.forms.test_email.email_wil: The email will be send to {email}
message.admin.forms.health_endpoint.help: URL you can visit to check the health of this 2FAuth instance. This URL can be used to set up a Docker HEALTHCHECK or a Kubernetes HTTPS Liveness probe.
message.admin.forms.cache_management.hel: Sometimes cache needs to be cleared, for instance after a change to environment variables or an update. You can do it from here.
message.admin.forms.store_icon_to_databa: Uploaded icons are registered in the database in addition to the file system storage, which is then used only as a cache. This makes creating a 2FAuth backup much easier, as only the database has to be backed up. TODO DOUBLE LINEBREAK HERE But beware, this may has some drawbacks: The database size may increase significantly if the instance hosts many large icons. It may also affect the application performance because the file system is hit more often to ensure it is synchronised with the database.
message.auth.failed: These credentials do not match our records.
message.auth.throttle: Too many login attempts. Please try again in {seconds} seconds.
message.auth.password_login_and_webauthn: Password login and WebAuthn are disabled.
message.auth.sign_in_using_sso: Pick an SSO provider to sign in with:
message.auth.see_how_to_enable_sso: See how to enable a provider
message.auth.sign_in_using_security_devi: Sign in using a security device
message.auth.autolock_triggered_punchlin: Auto-lock triggered, you've been logged out
message.auth.already_authenticated: Already authenticated, please log out first
message.auth.user_account_controlled_by_: User account made available by an authentication proxy.
message.auth.manage_account_at_proxy_lev: Manage the account at proxy level.
message.auth.auth_handled_by_proxy: Authentication handled by a reverse proxy, below settings are disabled.
message.auth.sso_only_x_settings_are_dis: Authentication is restricted to SSO only, {auth_method} is disabled
message.auth.confirm.logout: Are you sure you want to log out?
message.auth.confirm.revoke_device: Are you sure you want to revoke this device?
message.auth.confirm.delete_account: Are you sure you want to delete your account?
message.auth.webauthn.security_devices_l: Authentication devices you can use to sign in 2FAuth, like security keys (i.e Yubikey) or smartphones with biometric capabilities (i.e. Apple FaceId/TouchId)
message.auth.webauthn.enhance_security_u: You can enhance the security of your 2FAuth account by enabling WebAuthn authentication.
message.auth.webauthn.webauthn_uses_trus: WebAuthn allows you to use trusted devices (like Yubikeys or smartphones with biometric capabilities) to sign in quickly and more securely.
message.auth.webauthn.use_security_devic: Get ready to authenticate using (one of) your security devices. Plug your key in, remove face mask or gloves, etc.
message.auth.webauthn.recovery_punchline: 2FAuth will send you a recovery link to this email address. Click the link in the received email and follow the instructions.
message.auth.webauthn.ensure_you_open_ma: Ensure you open the email on a device you fully own.
message.auth.webauthn.disable_all_securi: All your security devices will be revoked. Use this option if you have lost one or its security has been compromised.
message.auth.webauthn.recover_account_in: To recover your account, 2FAuth resets some Webauthn settings so you will be able to sign in using your email and password.
Make WebAuthn the only authorized method to log into your 2FAuth account. This is the recommended setup to take advantage of the WebAuthn enhanced security.TODO LINEBREAK HERE. In case of device lost, you will be able to recover your account by resetting this option and signing in using your email and password. TODO LINEBREAK HERE Attention! The Email & Password form remains available despite this option being enabled, but it will always return an 'Authentication failed' response.
message.auth.webauthn.need_a_security_de: Set at least one device to enable the following options
message.auth.forms.name: Name
message.auth.forms.sso_only_form_restric: Regular users must sign in with SSO. Other methods are for administrators only.
message.auth.forms.current_password.help: Fill in your current password to confirm that it's you
message.auth.forms.sign_in_using_email_p: You can connect using the email address {email} and the password {password}
message.auth.forms.you_need_an_account_t: You need an account to go further, please register yourself.
message.auth.forms.reset_punchline: 2FAuth will send you a password reset link to this address. Click the link in the received email to set a new password.
message.auth.forms.delete_your_account_a: Your user account will be deleted as well as all your 2FA data. There is no going back.
message.auth.forms.reset_your_password_t: If you always used SSO to sign in, sign out then use the reset password feature to get a password so you can fill this form.
message.auth.forms.deleting_2fauth_accou: Deleting your 2FAuth account has no impact on your external SSO account.
message.groups.manage_groups_legend: You can create groups to organize your accounts the way you want. All accounts remain visible in the pseudo group named 'All', regardless of the group they belong to.
message.groups.deleting_group_does_not_d: Deleting a group does not delete accounts
message.groups.confirm.delete: Are you sure you want to delete this group?
message.notifications.test_email_setting: You are receiving this email because you requested a test email to validate the email settings of your 2FAuth instance.
message.notifications.new_device.subject: Connection to 2FAuth from a new device
message.notifications.new_device.resume: A new device has just connected to your 2FAuth account.
message.notifications.new_device.connect: Here are the details of this connection
message.notifications.new_device.recomma: If this was you, you can ignore this alert. If you suspect any suspicious activity on your account, please change your password.
message.notifications.failed_login.resum: There has been a failed login attempt to your 2FAuth account.
message.notifications.failed_login.conne: Here are the details of this connection attempt
message.notifications.failed_login.recom: If this was you, you can ignore this alert. If further attempts fail, you should contact the 2FAuth administrator to review security settings and take action against this attacker.
message.settings.account_linked_to_sso_x: You signed-in via SSO using your {provider} account. Your information cannot be changed here but on {provider}.
message.settings.token_legend: Personal Access Tokens allow any app to authenticate to the 2Fauth API. You should specify the access token as a Bearer token in the authorization header of consumer apps requests.
message.settings.confirm.revoke: Are you sure you want to revoke this token?
message.settings.make_sure_copy_token: Make sure to copy your personal access token now. You won‚Äôt be able to see it again!
message.settings.settings_managed_by_adm: Some settings are being managed by your administrator
message.settings.forms.some_translation_: Some translations are missing using the browser preferred language?
message.settings.forms.language.label: Language
message.settings.forms.language.help: Language used to translate the 2FAuth user interface. Named languages are complete, set the one of your choice to override your browser preference.
message.settings.forms.timezone.label: Time zone
message.settings.forms.timezone.help: The time zone applied to all dates and times displayed in the application
message.settings.forms.show_otp_as_dot.h: Replace generated password characters with *** to ensure confidentiality. Does not affect the copy/paste feature
message.settings.forms.reveal_dotted_otp: Let the ability to temporarily reveal Dot-Obscured passwords
message.settings.forms.close_otp_on_copy: Click on a generated password to copy it automatically hides it from the screen
message.settings.forms.show_next_otp.hel: Preview the next password, i.e. the password that will replace the current password when it expires. Preferences set for the current OTP also apply to the next one (formatting, show as dot)
message.settings.forms.auto_close_timeou: Automatically hide on-screen password after a timeout. This avoids unnecessary requests for fresh passwords if you forget to close the password view.
message.settings.forms.clear_search_on_c: Empty the Search box right after a code has been copied to the clipboard
message.settings.forms.sort_case_sensiti: When invoked, force the Sort function to sort accounts on a case-sensitive basis
message.settings.forms.copy_otp_on_displ: Automatically copy a generated password right after it appears on screen. Due to browsers limitations, only the first Time-based One-Time Password (TOTP) will be copied, not the rotating ones
message.settings.forms.use_basic_qrcode_: If you experiences issues when capturing QR codes enables this option to switch to a more basic but more reliable QR code reader
message.settings.forms.display_mode.help: Choose whether you want accounts to be displayed as a list or as a grid
message.settings.forms.password_format.h: Change how the passwords are displayed by grouping digits to ease readability and memorization
message.settings.forms.half_legend: Split digits into two equals groups
message.settings.forms.theme.label: Theme
message.settings.forms.theme.help: Force a specific theme or apply the theme defined in your system/browser preferences
message.settings.forms.show_accounts_ico: Show account icons in the main view
message.settings.forms.get_official_icon: (Try to) Get the official icon of the 2FA issuer when adding an account
message.settings.forms.icon_collection.h: The icons collection to be queried at first when an official icon is required. Changing this setting does not refresh icons that have already been fetched.
message.settings.forms.icon_variant.help: Some icons are available in different flavors to best suit dark or light user interfaces. Set the one you want to look for first. The regular variant will automatically be fetched as a fallback.
message.settings.forms.icon_variant_stri: Narrow the fetch to the specified variant. If the variant is missing, 2FAuth will not try to fallback to the regular variant.
message.settings.forms.auto_lock.label: Auto lock
message.settings.forms.auto_lock.help: Log out the user automatically in case of inactivity. Has no effect when authentication is handled by a proxy and no custom logout url is specified.
message.settings.forms.default_group.hel: The group to which the newly created accounts are associated
message.settings.forms.view_default_grou: Always return to the default group when an OTP is copied
message.settings.forms.auto_save_qrcoded: New accounts are automatically registered after scanning or uploading a QR code, no need to click a Save button
Choose whether you want to be prompted to choose an input mode among those available or if you want to directly use the default input mode
message.settings.forms.defaultCaptureMod: Default input mode used when the Direct input option is On
message.settings.forms.remember_active_g: Save the last group filter applied and restore it on your next visit
message.settings.forms.otp_generation.he: Set how and when One-Time Passwords are displayed.
message.settings.forms.notify_on_new_aut: Get an email when a new device connects to your 2FAuth account for the first time
message.settings.forms.notify_on_failed_: Get an email each time an attempt to connect to your 2FAuth account fails
message.settings.forms.show_email_in_foo: Display the logged-in user's email in the footer instead of direct navigation links. The links are then available in a menu behind a click/tap on the email address.
message.settings.forms.otp_generation_on: Click an account to get a password in a dedicated view
Show all passwords in the main view, without doing anything
message.twofaccounts.add_first_account: Pick a method and add your first account
message.twofaccounts.twofauth_export_for: Export data using the 2FAuth json schema
You should prefer this option if you need to create a backup that can be restored. This format takes care of the icons.
The schema definition is described here:
message.twofaccounts.otpauth_export_form: Export data as a list of otpauth URIs
otpauth URI is the most common format used to exchange 2FA data, for example in the form of a QR code when you enable 2FA on a web site. Select this if you want to switch from 2FAuth.
message.twofaccounts.forms.use_qrcode.ti: Use a QR code to fill the form magically
message.twofaccounts.forms.unlock.title: Unlock it (at your own risk)
message.twofaccounts.forms.lock.title: Lock it
message.twofaccounts.forms.i_m_lucky_leg: The 'Try my luck' button tries to get a standard icon from the selected icon collection. The simpler the Service field value, the more likely you are to get the expected icon: Do not append any extension (like '.com'), use the exact name of the service, avoid special chars.
message.twofaccounts.forms.group.label: Group
message.twofaccounts.forms.group.help: The group to which the account is to be assigned
message.twofaccounts.forms.secret.label: Secret
message.twofaccounts.forms.secret.help: The key used to generate your security codes
message.twofaccounts.forms.otp_type.labe: Choose the type of OTP to create
message.twofaccounts.forms.otp_type.help: Time-based OTP or HMAC-based OTP or Steam OTP
message.twofaccounts.forms.digits.label: Digits
message.twofaccounts.forms.digits.help: The number of digits of the generated security codes
message.twofaccounts.forms.algorithm.hel: The algorithm used to secure your security codes
message.twofaccounts.forms.period.label: Period
message.twofaccounts.forms.period.help: The period of validity of the generated security codes in second
message.twofaccounts.forms.counter.label: Counter
message.twofaccounts.forms.counter.help_: It is risky to edit the counter as you can desynchronize the account with the verification server of the service. Use the lock icon to enable modification, but only if you know for you are doing
message.twofaccounts.forms.image.label: Image
message.twofaccounts.forms.image.help: The url of an external image to use as the account icon
message.twofaccounts.forms.options_help: You can leave the following options blank if you don"t know how to set them. The most commonly used values will be applied.
message.twofaccounts.forms.spaces_are_ig: Unwanted spaces will be automatically removed
message.twofaccounts.stream.need_grant_p: 2FAuth does not have permission to access your camera
You need to grant permission to use your device camera. If you already denied and your browser do not prompt you again, please refers to the browser documentation to find out how to grant permission.
It is usually done by clicking on a slashed camera icon in or next to the browser"s address bar
message.twofaccounts.stream.not_readable: Is the camera already in use? Ensure that no other app use your camera and try again
message.twofaccounts.stream.no_cam_on_de: Maybe you forgot to plug in your webcam
message.twofaccounts.stream.secured_cont: HTTPS is required for live scan. If you run 2FAuth from your computer, do not use virtual host other than localhost
message.twofaccounts.stream.stream_api_n: Stream API is not supported in this browser
You should use a modern browser
message.twofaccounts.confirm.delete: Are you sure you want to delete this account?
message.twofaccounts.confirm.cancel: Changes will be lost. Are you sure?
message.twofaccounts.confirm.discard: Are you sure you want to discard this account?
message.twofaccounts.confirm.discard_all: Are you sure you want to discard all accounts?
message.twofaccounts.confirm.discard_dup: Are you sure you want to discard all duplicates?
message.twofaccounts.import.import_legen: 2FAuth can import data from various 2FA apps.
Use the Export feature of these apps to get a migration resource like a QR code or a JSON file then load it here.
message.twofaccounts.import.supported_fo: Accepted: jpg, jpeg, png, bmp, gif, svg, or webp
message.twofaccounts.import.expected_for: Expected: A list of otpauth URI, one by line
message.twofaccounts.import.submitted_da: The following 2FA accounts were found in the migration resource. So far none of them have been added to 2FAuth.
message.twofaccounts.import.use_buttons_: Use the available buttons to permanently save them to your 2FA collection or discard them.
message.twofaccounts.import.possible_dup: An account with the exact same data already exists
message.twofaccounts.import.do_not_set_p: Do NOT enable Password protection or Encryption when you export data from a 2FA app otherwise 2FAuth will not be able to decipher them.

passwords.sent: We have emailed your password reset link!
passwords.token: This password reset token is invalid.
passwords.user: We can't find a user with that email address.
